title: About Macquarie
body: Macquarie's breadth of expertise covers advisory and capital markets, trading and hedging, funds management, asset finance, financing, research and retail financial services.
instruction: Select the arrows to find out more.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to find out more.

_items.title: Our operations
_items.body: The diversity of Macquarie's operations, combined with a strong capital position and robust risk management framework, has contributed to our 47-year record of unbroken profitability.

_items.title: Our people and locations
_items.body:
Macquarie employs more than 13,800 people in over 27 countries. Our global headquarters are located in Sydney, Australia.

As at 30 September 2016

_items.title: Our focus
_items.body: Since its inception, Macquarie has differentiated itself by focusing on new opportunities, both in product and geography, progressively building expertise and expanding into adjacent areas. From aircraft leasing to financing wind farms, our teams look for market opportunities where we can add real value and deliver specialist expertise.

_items.title: What We Stand For
_items.body:
Our principles of Opportunity, Accountability and Integrity underpin everything we do.

Our purpose is to realise opportunity for the benefit of our clients, our shareholders and our people. We are in business to be profitable, but it is the way we do business that defines us.

_items.title: Australia and NZ
_items.body:
Today, Macquarie in Australia and New Zealand:

  • Employs 6,288 people across 10 locations
  • Is Australia's largest global asset manager
  • Is ranked number one for Australian IPOs and announced and completed merger and acquisition deals in Australia
  • Contributes 41% of Macquarie's total operating income.

As at 30 September 2016

_items.title: Asia
_items.body:
Today, Macquarie in Asia:

  • Employs 3,474 people across 13 locations in 11 countries
  • Manages 40+ infrastructure businesses in five Asian markets
  • Is a leading warrants issuer in Asia by coverage
  • Contributes 11% of Macquarie's total operating income.

As at 30 September 2016

_items.title: Americas
_items.body:
Today, Macquarie in the Americas:

  • Employs 2,544 people across 21 locations in 4 countries
  • Is the third-largest marketer of physical gas in North America
  • Is a leading infrastructure investor with active funds across the Americas
  • Contributes 23% of Macquarie's total operating income.

As at 30 September 2016

_items.title: EMEA
_items.body:
Macquarie in Europe, Middle East and Africa:

  • Employs 1,510 people across 15 locations in 10 countries
  • Has the number one global commodities research team based in London
  • Manages 50+ infrastructure and real assets business in the region
  • Contributes 25% of Macquarie's total operating income.

As at 30 September 2016

title: Our purpose
body: Our purpose is to realise opportunity for the benefit of our clients, our shareholders and our people. We are in business to be profitable, but it is the way we do business that defines us.

title: Opportunity, Accountability, Integrity
body: Find out more about our culture, working environment, and the opportunities available to you.
instruction: Select the arrows to find out more.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to find out more.

_items.title: Opportunity
_items.body: We seek to identify opportunity and realise it for our clients, community, shareholders and our people. We start with real knowledge and skill. We encourage innovation, ingenuity and entrepreneurial spirit. We support our people to achieve and succeed. Our success is built on this.

_items.title: Accountability
_items.body: With opportunity comes accountability. We are accountable for all our actions, to our clients, our community, our shareholders and each other. We never compromise our standards. We take responsibility for our actions and everything we say and do is on the record. We analyse and manage risk, and we make decisions we are proud of.

_items.title: Integrity
_items.body: We always act honestly and fairly. We honour our promises. We earn the trust of our clients, colleagues, community and shareholders through the quality of our work and our high ethical standards. We have the courage to speak up when we make a mistake or see something that doesn't seem right.

title: Diversity at Macquarie
body: The diverse experiences, skills and views of our people are key strengths and critical to the wide range of services Macquarie delivers across the globe, as well as understanding the communities in which we operate.
instruction: Select play to hear about diversity and inclusion at Macquarie.

title: Diversity and inclusion
body: In every one of our offices you'll find individuals from varied backgrounds with different ways of thinking, different skills and different experiences. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings.

title: Own your future
body: Macquarie provides a range of opportunities for development. You will be able to build your experience through challenging assignments, pursue new initiatives and learn from the best — your peers. This will enable you to be your best and to demonstrate your skills.
instruction: Select each icon to learn how our people take advantage of opportunities and own their careers.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows followed by the plus icon to learn how our people take advantage of opportunities and drive their careers.

_items.title: Lisa's story
_items.body:
Lisa, Division Director, Macquarie Capital (MacCap), New York

"If there is something new that you would like to try or an area you are interested in, speak up and be yourself."

I'm a Managing Director in the Debt Capital Markets team in New York. I started my career at Macquarie in 2011. Since then, I have been part of a lot of firsts here, including Macquarie Capital's first sole bookrun bond transaction in the US.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

_items.title: Andrew's story
_items.body:
Andrew, Division Director, Corporate and Asset Finance, Sydney

"It is the intelligence and work ethic of the people that really stand out. This is a clear differentiator in our marketplace".

As the enterprise sales manager for Macquarie Equipment Finance in ANZ, I lead a sales team which lends money to public and large enterprise sectors. A career highlight of mine was the establishment and building of Macquarie's Equipment Finance business in Canada.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

_items.title: Gavin's story
_items.body:
Gavin, Division Director, Macquarie Securities Group (MSG), Hong Kong

"Working in a variety of offices has taught me the importance of teamwork and responsibility. I've been able to build my own strong client base within a supportive and professional setting."

In 2005 I started as a graduate in MSG in Singapore before transitioning into sales trading in 2006. I moved to HK in August 2009 and made AD in 2010. I was promoted to Head of HK/China Sales Trading in September 2012.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

_items.title: Shemara's story
_items.body:
Shemara, Group Head Macquarie Asset Management (MAM), Sydney

"I encourage my staff to think of themselves as a business owner; to take ownership and responsibility."

I've been at Macquarie for over 20 years – I started as a graduate when we had only 300 people and during my time I've seen the business grow and likewise I've grown with it. I'm now Group Head of MAM, managing a team of 1,500 across 21 countries. My career at Macquarie has taken me to nine different cities across six countries.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

_items.title: Dana's story
_items.body:
Dana, Senior Manager, Banking and Financial Services (BFS), Sydney

"Initiative gets rewarded, and whilst success is the aim, failure is seen as a learning opportunity."

My role as Strategic Advice Specialist entails meeting with high net-worth individual clients of the Macquarie Private Bank to provide advice on how best to structure their financial assets. My best career achievement has been proactively providing advice to a client based on a good understanding of his situation, his long-term goals and prevailing legislation that ended up saving him a significant amount in taxes.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

_items.title: Berna's story
_items.body:
Berna, Senior Manager, Corporate Operations Group (COG), Manila

"I like how approachable the senior management team is and how supportive people are in driving the unified goal of providing quality service to our clients and improving our processes."

I am the HR Information Systems (HRIS) team manager, overseeing 15 staff in the administration of systems such as PeopleSoft, GPS, MyLearning and PageUp, as well as the reporting of HR data. I joined Macquarie as the first PeopleSoft HR system administrator in Manila. After a year, when HR Shared Services was founded, I was given the opportunity to lead the HRIS team and this has been a particularly rewarding experience.

Visit Macnet for the full story.

title: Macquarie Group Foundation
body: The Macquarie Group Foundation is one of Australia's oldest and largest corporate benefactors.
instruction: Select the arrows to find out more.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to find out more.

_items.title: Our work
_items.body: The Foundation supports community programs around the world, focusing on the issues our people are passionate about, whether in education, health, welfare, the environment or the arts. As well as matching staff donations and fundraising, it also provides multi-year grant funding to non-profits making a difference within their community.

_items.title: Supporting you
_items.body: If you ever donate to or raise money for charity, you can apply to the Macquarie Group Foundation for matching under our staff support policy. With one of the most generous matching policies amongst its peers, the Foundation also provides one-off donations to a non-profit organisation if you sit on its governing board as well as donates to your preferred charity when you reach 10 or 25 years' service at Macquarie.

_items.title: Recognising you
_items.body: Each year, the Foundation recognises outstanding staff contributions through the Macquarie Staff in the Community Awards. Award winners across volunteering, fundraising, pro bono and team work categories win $A10,000 for their charity, while highly commended award recipients receive $A2,000.

_items.title: Funding community organisations
_items.body: There are many inspiring things being done by community organisations, large and small. The Foundation Committee's criteria for evaluating community grants includes significant staff involvement in an organisation, an innovative approach to addressing the problem at hand and working in collaboration with others in that non-profit sector. We like opportunities that are innovative, genuinely responsive to community needs and where we can contribute our time and expertise, as well as our financial support. We also work to build the capacity of the non-profit sector, helping make it more efficient.

_items.title: Get involved
_items.body: If you'd like to hear about ways you can volunteer, sign up to our Get Involved alerts, a convenient way to find out more about local volunteering opportunities or speak to your local Foundation representative.

title: Our business activities
body: Our unique management style and strong risk culture help us to succeed.
instruction: Select the arrows to learn more about our business.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to learn more about our business.

_items.title: Our strength
_items.body: Macquarie's strength lies in our unique structure and management style which enables our businesses to exercise significant operating freedom balanced by limits on risk and the adherence to professional standards.

_items.title: How we're organised
_items.body: Macquarie is comprised of six operating groups and four support groups within which individual businesses operate. These businesses work closely together, specialising in defined product or market sectors, and are committed to their client's relationship with Macquarie as a whole.

_items.title: How we manage risk
_items.body: Our business activities are encompassed by a strong risk management framework and are facilitated by a number of Macquarie-wide support groups.

body: Now take a moment to explore each group's activities in more detail.

title: Operating Groups
body: Explore each group's activities in more detail.
instruction: Select the arrows to learn about each operating group.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to learn about each operating group.

_items.title: Macquarie Capital
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as MacCap

Group Head: Tim Bishop

What we do

Macquarie Capital provides advisory and capital raising services to corporate and government clients involved in public mergers and acquisitions, private treaty acquisitions and divestments, debt and equity fund raising and corporate restructuring. It also undertakes principal investing activities globally in support of its client activities.

_items.title: MacCap — advisory activities
_items.body:
Advisory activities are divided into industry groups, reflecting key areas of expertise in:

  • Financial institutions
  • Industrials
  • Infrastructure, utilities and renewables
  • Real estate
  • Resources (mining and energy)
  • Telecommunications, Media, Entertainment and Technology (TMET)

_items.title: Macquarie Asset Management
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'MAM'

Group head: Shemara Wikramanayake

What we do

Macquarie Asset Management is a full-service asset manager, offering a diverse range of capabilities and products. MAM is a top 50 global asset manager with $A491.3 billion of assets under management.

_items.title: MAM — areas of expertise
_items.body:
Key areas of expertise include:

  • Infrastructure and real asset management
  • Securities investment management
  • Tailored investment solutions over funds and listed equities

_items.title: Commodities and Global Markets
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'CGM'

Group Head: Andrew Downe

What we do

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with risk and capital solutions across physical and financial markets. CGM provides financing financial hedging, physical execution and access to market pricing for clients exposed to commodities and financial markets.

_items.title: CGM — areas of expertise
_items.body:
Key areas of expertise include:

  • Credit markets
  • Energy markets
  • Fixed income and Currencies
  • Futures
  • Metals, Mining and Agriculture

_items.title: Banking and Financial Services Group
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'BFS'

Group Head: Greg Ward

What we do

Banking and Financial Services Group comprises Macquarie's retail banking and financial services businesses, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management and business banking products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers and business clients.

_items.title: BFS — areas of expertise
_items.body:
Key areas of expertise include:

  • Personal Banking; mortgages, credit cards and deposits
  • Wealth Management; superannuation and insurance products, stockbroking, financial advice, private banking, cash management and wrap platform services
  • Business Banking; deposit, lending and payment solutions

_items.title: Corporate and Asset Finance Group
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'CAF'

Group Co-Heads: Garry Farrell and Ben Brazil.

What we do

The Corporate and Asset Finance Group consists of an asset finance business which provides specialist finance and asset management solutions globally, and a lending business which provides primary financing to clients and invests in credit assets in secondary markets.

_items.title: CAF — areas of expertise
_items.body:
Key areas of expertise include:

  • Aircraft, motor vehicles ad rail
  • Technology
  • Healthcare
  • Manufacturing
  • Industrial
  • Energy
  • Mining equipment

title: Support Groups
body: Explore each group's activities in more detail.
instruction: Select the arrows to learn about each support group.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows and then the plus icons to learn about each support group.

_items.title: Risk Management Group
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'RMG'

Group Head: Stephen Allen

What we do

Macquarie's Risk Management Group is an independent, centralised unit responsible for assessing and monitoring risks across Macquarie.

_items.title: RMG divisions
_items.body:
RMG comprises the following divisions:

  • Compliance
  • Credit
  • Internal Audit
  • Market Risk
  • Operational Risk
  • Prudential, Capital and Markets
  • Quantitative Applications
  • Technology

_items.title: Legal and Governance
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'LGL'

Group Head: Michael Herring

What we do

Legal and Governance provide legal advice and services which further Macquarie's goals and values and protect the financial integrity and reputation of the organisation. Legal and Governance comprises Group Legal and Corporate Governance.

_items.title: LGL — Group Legal
_items.body: Group Legal provides a full range of legal services to Macquarie, from strategic legal advice on corporate transactions, to managing litigation and dispute resolution proceedings, through to advising senior management and the board on risk assessment frameworks for legal, regulatory and reputational matters.

_items.title: LGL — Corporate Governance Division
_items.body: The Corporate Governance Division is responsible for providing services to the Macquarie Group Board, the Board Committees, Macquarie's subsidiary companies and Macquarie's Executive Committee. This division is also responsible for maintaining Macquarie's ASX listing rule compliance, employee equity schemes, professional risk and general insurances and Group-wide corporate governance matters.

_items.title: Financial Management Group
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'FMG'

Group Head: Patrick Upfold

What we do

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services, as well as handling communications and investor relations, for all of Macquarie.

_items.title: Financial Management Group — divisions
_items.body:
FMG comprises the following divisions:

  • Finance Division
  • Group Treasury
  • Taxation
  • Corporate Communications and Investor Relations

_items.title: Corporate Operations Group
_items.body:
Known across Macquarie as 'COG'

Group Head: Nicole Sorbara

What we do

Corporate Operations Group (COG) provides infrastructure, operations, advisory and risk support to Macquarie. The primary purpose of COG is to enable the entrepreneurial enterprise, and to deliver value and agility to Macquarie through the creation of an efficient and scalable operating model.

_items.title: COG — divisions
_items.body:
COG comprises the following divisions:

  • Business Improvement and Strategy
  • Business Services
  • COG Business Management
  • COG Operational Risk Strategy and Support (CORSS)
  • Human Resources
  • Market Operations
  • Technology

title: Starting your journey
body: You've heard our story — you've explored our history, growth and our businesses and have a sense of what it's like to work at Macquarie. Now it's time to write your story. To own your future.
instruction: Select the arrows for five tips for building a successful career at Macquarie.
mobileInstruction: Select the arrows followed by the plus icon for five tips for building a successful career at Macquarie.

_items.title: Champion What We Stand For
_items.body: Act with integrity, realise opportunity and be accountable to our clients, shareholders and our communities. These are all vital to the continued growth and success of our business and key to a successful career at Macquarie.

_items.title: Embrace our supportive culture
_items.body: Macquarie's management philosophy of opportunity with accountability is there to support you. Know your world, get out there, find the next opportunity and give it a go.

_items.title: Make a difference
_items.body: Make a difference for clients and colleagues. Take on the tough problems and do more than you are asked to.

_items.title: Be confident
_items.body: Be confident in everything you do. Be resilient and grow from your mistakes.

_items.title: Be a generous team member
_items.body: Macquarie recognises that the best performing individuals are team players. Share your problems and take advantage of others' expertise and experience.

title: Well done!
body:
This module is a key component in your introduction to Macquarie. We hope it has given you a feel for what it is like to work at Macquarie, what we do and how you can make the most of your career here.

Following this, you will be prompted to complete other orientation components to meet training and compliance regulations for your location.

If you have any questions about your orientation, please speak to your manager or email the HR Service Desk.

You may now close this module or return to the Menu to review any of the topics.
